properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 12 at 1:57AM PST until January 12 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...An above normal high tide of 6.5 feet late this morning
combined with elevated surf of 3 to 6 ft will result in the
possibility of localized minor coastal flooding over low-lying
coastal areas such as beach parking lots and harbor walkways.
Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves are also expected.

* WHERE...West-facing beaches of the Ventura County Coast.

* WHEN...From 7 AM PST this morning through this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip
currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can
wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats
nearshore.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An above normal high tide of 6.5 ft is
expected around 9:30am this morning.
properties.instruction:
Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or
stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly
in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM PST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON
